metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11712 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
POST requests made by NPAPI plugins, such as Flash, that receive a status308 redirect response can bypass CORS requirements. This can allow anattacker to perform Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird <60.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
